University of Manchester Physics 04-08

2 hrs of lecture per week for each course. For some courses, especially in later years these would be a back to back double lecture.

Lecture sizes from ~300 for first year compulsory to ~30 for 4th year electives.

1st & 2nd year  -  1 hr per week 4 person tutorials on core moduals.

3rd -   1 hr/pw 20 person workshop 

4th  - 1 hr/pw  workshop for each modual 

All years, 2 days per week of Labs, with contact time to phd students in years 1-3, professors in 4th.  Labs worth 20 credits (2 moduals) in years 1-3, 40 in year 4.

Tutors and Lecturers available by email and in their offices during normal hours (10-6)

Weekly non-compulsory homework for each modual (it was worth 5% of grade for year 1-2 courses).  Graded in tutorials.   Some courses had a coursework component if the lecturer wanted to set it.  These were usually 10-20% of the grade.

1 group work project per year  with a research methodology angle , usually worth half a modual. 

Most of the course books were available at the library  but copies were limited.   Lots of handouts given in ectures, most of which were made available on-line by the lectures.  

Attendance was compulsory at Tutorials, Labs and Workshops but not a Lectures.



I felt all through my course that I was getting excellent teaching and contact time, especially compared to some of my friends doing humanities who got 6 hrs per week in a 300 person lecture and 1 30 person workshop.
